channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ikea’s outgoing CEO on succession, sustainability, and knowing when to move on
item.description: After eight years at the helm of Ingka Group, the operating entity behind home-furnishing giant Ikea, CEO Jesper Brodin is stepping down. Brodin expla...

item.title: Your Company’s Next CEO Might Be a ‘Multihyphenate’
item.description: Chief CEO Alison Moore explains how a new generation of women executives will lead.

item.title: Trump’s $100,000 visa targets a $280 billion India success story

item.title: Figma’s World Is Growing Quickly
item.description: The design kingpin just entered multiple new categories and added more AI. CEO Dylan Field says it’s all still about helping humans craft better produ...

item.title: Loneliness can be deadly for cancer patients. This app helps foster connections
item.description: Amaya Matos was 19 years old when she was diagnosed with acute myeloid leukemia. She’d just graduated high school, but instead of heading off to colle...

item.title: Why design challenges are the wrong tool for assessing talent
item.description: Over the last decade, design challenges have become a controversial tool in hiring designers. Intended to evaluate how candidates think, behave, commu...

item.title: Trump’s plan to charge $100,000 for new H-1B visas is met with dismay by CEOs who want the world’s top talent
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Shark Tank Returns With 2 Big Changes, and the Most Guest Sharks Ever
item.description: ABC’s hit show has generated more than $11 billion in retail sales for companies backed by the sharks.

item.title: Amazon sustainability chief & top scientist: AI could end up being climate’s most powerful tool
item.description: At Amazon, we processed 15 billion carbon-related data points in 2024 alone. AI is the force multiplier that sustainability efforts have desperately n...

item.title: U.S. lawmakers call for more military dialogue with China as premier Li Qiang welcomes ‘icebreaking trip’
item.description: "I’m deeply concerned that our two militaries don’t communicate more," said Rep. Adam Smith, who led the Congressional delegation to China.

item.title: How Sarah de Lagarde, who lost two limbs in a train accident, is using AI to develop accessible new tech—including her “kick-ass robot arm”

item.title: I gave ChatGPT $500 of real money to invest in stocks. Its picks surprised me
item.description: When OpenAI launched its new GPT-5 model in August, the company bragged loud and hard about how GPT-5 is its “smartest, fastest, most useful model yet...

item.title: This Company Just Raised $1 Billion to Deliver a Quantum Computer by 2027
item.description: PsiQuantum has an ambitious timeline, aiming to break ground on quantum computing sites in two locations in the coming months.

item.title: This 30-story skyscraper in China doesn’t need AC to stay cool

item.title: Small-Cap Stocks Are Doing Exactly What Bulls Expected After a Rate Cut
item.description: The Federal Reserve kicked off a broadening bull run.
